pageContent:
The evangelical RCGP leader provides a hopeful if at times bewildering take on the state of the nation's healthcare
		Martin Marshall, head of the Royal College of GPs, likes to tell a story. It’s about a patient at the East End practice where he works, a man called Mohammed in his early 40s, married with two young daughters.
